snippet: The administration worried that splits within the Taliban could lead gun-wielding guards to kill Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl before he was turned over to American forces.
abstract: Senior Obama administration official says that operation to free Sgt Bowe Bergdahl was kept closely held secret due to fear that splits within Taliban could lead to killing of soldier before he was turned over to American forces in exchange for five Taliban detainees.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and PETER BAKER
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Peter Baker from Brussels. Mark Mazzetti, Michael D. Shear and Jennifer Steinhauer contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The administration worried that splits within the Taliban could lead gun-wielding guards to kill Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl before he was turned over to American forces.

headline.main: Fears for Sergeant’s Life Led to Secrecy About Swap, Obama Official Says
headline.print_headline: Fears for Sergeant’s Life Led to Secrecy About Swap, Obama Official Says
